full_text: What a fantastic achievement. Congratulations @FAIreland @verapauw and all the squad! #Ireland 🇮🇪 https://t.co/Sl1ptaNZe5
https://t.co/8TYbJL7lKd

Ted Crosbie was one of life’s gentlemen. Uniquely charming, funny, thoughtful, always positive. Ted was a #Cork treasure.  His contribution to media & business was significant & continues.  To his family my deepest sympathies. We’ve lost a special person.  https://t.co/9FKenDnvmI
@BeattieDoug @uuponline Thanks Doug

Such a dark day for Ireland as tragedy continues to unfold in Donegal. Our hearts & prayers go out to all impacted & the community of Creeslough.  We are so thankful to all emergency services and our friends from NI who have been so helpful in such difficult circumstances.

Thinking of and praying for the community of Cresslough and across Donegal tonight. Such a shocking and tragic day, continuing into tonight. Thank you to all emergency teams working together through the night.
@RobinSwannMoH @NIAS999 @NIFRSOFFICIAL @AirAmbulanceNI Sincere thanks for your help today Robin. Very sad and tragic day.

My pleasure to host UK Foreign Secretary @JamesCleverly at the Irish Embassy London for a working dinner. James & I discussed Brexit, the protocol, the war in Ukraine as well as our shared work at the UN Security Council. We agreed to work closely together on all. 🇮🇪🇬🇧 https://t.co/To01YdO6nW
Amazing creatures. Need protection. Good news. 🐳🐬🏄🏼‍♂️ https://t.co/1RIPa6N4mP

Great to be in Ennis tonight with Nora Owen & Prof Michael Laffan to talk about the history of ⁦@FineGael⁩ and our role in the establishment of the state from 1922-1932 and current political challenges.  Big turnout, thank you! ⁦@joecareytd⁩ ⁦@conwayforclare⁩ https://t.co/Ks9XFF5bqV
Important stat. Food security matters. That’s why our farming and food industries need to be protected and supported as we transition to a more sustainable future. https://t.co/TDMGzkaPp3
https://t.co/FBWqzix6XE
https://t.co/o4sSvKqpKQ

Very constructive meeting this morning with new Secretary of State for NI ⁦@chhcalling⁩. We are both absolutely committed to working together in partnership to facilitate the return of devolved Government in Northern Ireland by the end of October. 🇮🇪🇬🇧 https://t.co/3Bnh0MkWCF
Looking forward to welcoming @MichelBarnier back today. A close friend of #Ireland always welcome back to #Dublin. #EU50 @dfatirl https://t.co/qmlh36DROv
Ireland will never recognise the results of Russia’s sham referendums in Eastern Ukraine.   They are illegal and illegitimate.  🇮🇪🇺🇦

Todays budget was fair.  Government has focused resources on those that need it the most. We know families are under pressure to pay bills, that’s why those on lowest incomes get the most support, while recognising middle income family’s need support also. https://t.co/SqExDgvOuy
Shana Tova to all Jewish communities in Ireland and across the world celebrating today. May a new year bring happiness and peace.  #ShanaTova #RoshHashana

Russia has committed war crimes in Ukraine, say UN investigators.  Accountability matters. Ireland will continue to support the International Criminal Court to pursue cases and prosecutions. #Ukraine  https://t.co/CxTYO6cLuS

Ireland pledged €50m today at #UN, in partnership with USAID & @UNICEF, to respond to Child malnutrition on the Horn of Africa. A famine is almost certain as a result of drought, poverty and conflict.  This will save many children’s lives.  @PowerUSAID @dfatirl @Irish_Aid @USAID https://t.co/BrTrRhiKnS
Ireland’s work on the #UN Security Council matters. Small countries can make a difference! @dfatirl @irishmissionun @IRLDeptDefence @defenceforces https://t.co/HjAAgYe3Xa

This is a significant escalation in Russia’s war on #Ukraine. A ‘partial mobilisation’ in Russia will prolong this tragic, illegal conflict & increase deaths. Sham referendums planned in occupied parts of Ukraine will never be recognised by Int community.  https://t.co/dWn5g2ZLt2
Leo Varadkar: 'This budget will put money back in your pocket' https://t.co/0hjjfV23I7
Great to be at the Ploughing today! @NPAIE #Ploughing2022 https://t.co/4wjkR5VXuR

Great to be back at the Ploughing! Huge crowds, great weather, good chat & debate on all things farming! @finegael as ever is here to listen & support farm families.  Farming is the heartbeat of rural Ireland. Thank you ⁦⁦@NPAIE⁩ https://t.co/IifUXcr2FT
@pattheenglishm1 It was a special day for #Cork
Fantastic achievement. A position of real significance. Congratulations to Judge Síofra OLeary. @dfatirl https://t.co/y0aLuz040F

Following my meeting this morning with President Mahmoud Abbas and Foreign Minister Riyad al-Maliki, Ireland is announcing an additional €2m in funding for @UNRWA, bringing this years contribution to over €8m. ⁦@dfatirl⁩ https://t.co/gNqpa8ymOE

Meeting President Mahmoud Abbas & FM Riyad Al-Maliki this morning, in advance of #UN General Assembly this week. The ongoing plight of Palestinian people is an injustice that shames the international community.  #Ireland continues to work for Peace & a 2 State Solution. @dfatirl https://t.co/99Kq68dQkP

As Minister for Defence it was my honour this afternoon to review the 130 members of the 66th Infantry Group who are about to deploy on peacekeeping duties to the Golan Heights as part of #UNDOF @defenceforces @IRLDeptDefence #BeMore. https://t.co/OawIMPAVeI

It was great to speak today to the new U.K. Foreign Secretary @JamesCleverly. I look forward to working with him on #Brexit and all of the foreign policy goals that Ireland and the U.K. share across the globe. 🇮🇪🇬🇧
Brussels offers to reduce Northern Ireland border checks. #Brexit  https://t.co/Bli0hJ9P0X

Very sad news that Tom Cavanagh has passed away.  He was an extraordinary pioneer for social progress & provided significant philanthropic funds to many life changing causes. He’ll be missed by so many. My thoughts are with his family & friends. RIP https://t.co/Vvp7oMYADn
https://t.co/ur8DLdGKbo

Good initial conversation with Chris Heaton-Harris, new Sec of State for Northern Ireland, today. Looking forward to meeting in the coming weeks. A lot of work to do together. 🇮🇪🇬🇧 @chhcalling @NIOgov @dfatirl
Congratulations to @JamesCleverly on his appointment as UK Foreign Secretary. #Ireland looks forward to working closely with you on a very busy foreign policy agenda. 🇮🇪 🇬🇧 @dfatirl @FCDOGovUK
@ShaileshVara @NIOgov Thank you for your courtesy and work during your time as SOSNI. I wish you well for the future.

Congratulations to @chhcalling for his appointment as new Sec of State for Northern Ireland. I’ve known him since we were both members of the European Parliament & I look forward to working closely with him in the coming months.  First job - a functioning executive for NI. 🇮🇪🇬🇧

As constructive as ever. @MarosSefcovic looking to reach out to find solutions through partnership and constructive engagement. We in the Irish Government will play our part in seeking a compromise that works for all sides and meets legal obligations. @dfatirl https://t.co/ty5cJ5sV7Q
Brilliant result for a fantastic team. Congratulations! @FAIreland https://t.co/nv7BCI6ZPt
@Eoinmpos Congratulations! Special times, enjoy.

Meeting EU Defence and Foreign ministers for 2 days to focus on how we can further support Ukraine.  #Ireland will support increased EPF funding & also the proposal to set up a structured EU training mission  to support training of Ukrainian military.  https://t.co/H4S7NkScsk

My deepest condolences to the people of Pakistan following the devastating floods which have hit the country. We have committed an initial contribution of €500,000 in emergency humanitarian funding in response to the Government of Pakistan’s request for assistance. @dfatirl
Strongly support @JosepBorrellF in this statement. Civil society organisations need to be protected, particularly in areas of conflict. @dfatirl https://t.co/pF6toUMEV1

Reopening our Embassy in Kyiv is an important statement of solidarity and support to #Ukraine. #Ireland will be there for Ukrainians, through this war, for the rebuilding process in the aftermath and on the pathway to #EU membership!  #StandWithUkraine 🇮🇪🇺🇦🇪🇺 https://t.co/Va8l5VNSBa

Real privilege to lay a wreath and speak at Sam’s Cross this morning and to visit the Four Alls bar (Collins’ local pub).  It’s a weekend for everyone to commemorate the extraordinary contribution and sacrifice of General Michael Collins to shaping Irish history. https://t.co/jNb1Xt7Wmo
Fantastic afternoon in Clonakilty, celebrating and commemorating at the Michael Collins Festival. @MCclon22 ⁦@Corkcoco⁩ https://t.co/7GD6cpcwsQ
Big weekend ahead. https://t.co/lKsX32If0O
Fantastic result for Ireland as they claim Aga Khan after jump-off. Well done to all involved. ⁦@HorseSportIRL⁩  https://t.co/yptRT3Yrt6
Michael Collins centenary: Everything you need to know about the Béal na Bláth event https://t.co/tkiAc3rH4t

Very sad to learn of the passing of Frank Crowley. One of the kindest, wisest most decent, down to earth politicians I’ve known. He made a real impact in Dáil Éireann & ⁦⁦⁦⁦@Corkcoco⁩ My thoughts are with his wife Winifred, daughter Leah, son Ken, family & friends. https://t.co/pdXbv13VXX
@DeclanKearneySF Welcome statement.

Whether in July or August, this kind of hatred is so far from the future we should be trying to build.  To all volunteers, community workers, youth orgs. & others working for reconciliation & respect, this is an insult to your efforts. We will work harder with you for peace! https://t.co/jgiqsaPKn6
Incredible record! https://t.co/t8VPjxASUA

@DanMulhall @JudeLPerry @IrelandEmbUSA @AerLingus Thanks @DanMulhall for the fantastic job you’ve done representing #Ireland during a crucial and busy period. We have a lot to thank you for! Welcome home ☘️.
@mickmuldoon Great team in @PassportIRL @dfatirl trying to improve turnaround times all the time.
Good luck to ⁦@CorkCamogie⁩ today! https://t.co/8dl20UT77a
Unemployment rate falls to 21-year low of 4.2% in July https://t.co/ZVtKcVFJDe
Redeveloped Béal na Bláth looks great. Well done to all involved! Looking forward to August 21st.  @Corkcoco @defenceforces @gardainfo @FineGael https://t.co/N1JYJGgPEi

Very positive new development for #CorkCity. The Cork docklands are really taking shape now and will drive job creation and economic growth in the city.  Plans approved for the first phase of Cork's South Docks redevelopment. https://t.co/PqMwM6gxFY

Rest in Peace David Trimble. Thank you for your political courage and your immense contribution to making peace.  Your place in history will be a very positive one.  Respect & condolences to all the Trimble family,  ⁦@uuponline⁩ & all unionists.  https://t.co/GwzqkxRcja

David Trimble showed leadership at a time when Nothern Ireland so badly needed it.  All politicians from all traditions should be inspired by his courage.  My thoughts tonight are with his family, his wife Daphne, his UUP colleagues & unionist community. https://t.co/60XnF9ZkzJ

Less than 24 hrs after the Grain Deal was signed in Istanbul, this is a cynical Russian attack.  Full implementation of the deal is essential to stop millions in Horn of Africa & Middle East from the devastating consequences of severe food insecurity. @dfatirl @irishmissionun https://t.co/r6bv1jZXa5

@ALLYPIP2 You make a fair point on goods staying in UK.  Last year EU recognised that goods from GB, staying in NI, should be treated very differently and require far fewer checks.  I advocated for that & believe it can be the basis for an agreed compromise. But we need a partner in UK.
